page.title: 14 HOUSING
page.content: In the tree-lined streets of Hall Green, most of the homes are owned by the residents. Of the five thousand two hundred and eighty three homes, approximately half are semi-detached while a further eight hundred are detached. Four hundred and fifty one houses are terraced. Forty two old people's bungalows have recently been completed and there are six hundred and ninety one flats. Two hundred and twenty council houses and a hundred council flats are also included together with seventeen pre-fabs. Because of lack of accommodation during the second world war, these were built in the 1940's as an interim measure until such time as more permanent homes could be provided. However, they are still occupied in 1985!
